alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 7:35PM EDT until August 13 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Bradford and Susquehanna. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 735 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Towanda, Rush, Wysox, North Towanda, Herrick, Rome, Le Raysville, Brushville, Rushville, Camptown, Herrickville, Auburn Center, Stevensville, Silvara, West Auburn, Lawton, Macedonia and Elk Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
